J	Ji, ZC				Ji, Zhuchao			Structure of Julia sets for post-critically finite endomorphisms on P-2	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							HOLOMORPHIC MAPS; DYNAMICS; LAMINARITY; POINTS; AXIOM	Let f be a post-critically finite endomorphism (PCF map for short) on P-2, let J(1) denote the Julia set and let J(2) denote the support of the measure of maximal entropy. In this paper we show that: 1. J(1) \ J(2) is contained in the union of the (finitely many) basins of critical component cycles and stable manifolds of sporadic super-saddle cycles. 2. For every x is an element of J(2) which is not contained in the stable manifold of a sporadic super-saddle cycle, there is no Fatou disk containing x. Here sporadic means that the super-saddle cycle is not contained in a critical component cycle. Under the additional assumption that all branches of PC(f) are smooth and intersect transversally, we show that there is no sporadic super-saddle cycle. Thus in this case J(1) \ J(2) is contained in the union of the basins of critical component cycles, and for every x is an element of J(2) there is no Fatou disk containing x. As consequences of our result: 1.We answer some questions of Fornaess-Sibony about the non-wandering set for PCF maps on P-2 with no sporadic super-saddle cycles. 2. We give a new proof of de Thelin's laminarity of the Green currents in J(1) \ J(2) for PCF maps on P-2. 3. We show that for PCF maps on P-2 an invariant compact set is expanding if and only if it does not contain critical points, and we obtain characterizations of PCF maps on P-2 which are expanding on J(2) or satisfy Axiom A.	[Ji, Zhuchao] Sorbonne Univ, Lab Probabilites Stat & Modelisat LPSM, UMR 8001, 4 Pl Jussieu, F-75252 Paris 05, France; [Ji, Zhuchao] Fudan Univ, Shanghai Ctr Math Sci, Jiangwan Campus,2005 Songhu Rd, Shanghai 200438, Peoples R China	UDICE-French Research Universities; J	Qiu, CL				Qiu, Congling			The Gross-Zagier-Zhang formula over function fields	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							AUTOMORPHIC L-FUNCTIONS; TAYLOR EXPANSION; SWINNERTON-DYER; POOR REDUCTION; HEEGNER POINTS; SHTUKAS; VALUES; POSITIVITY; CONJECTURE; CHARACTERS	We prove the Gross-Zagier-Zhang formula over global function fields of arbitrary characteristics. It is an explicit formula which relates the Neron-Tate heights of CM points on abelian varieties and central derivatives of associated quadratic base change L-functions. Our proof is based on an arithmetic variant of a relative trace identity of Jacquet. This approach is proposed by Zhang. We apply our results to the Birch and Swinnerton-Dyer conjecture for abelian varieties of GL(2)-type. In particular, we prove the conjecture for elliptic curves of analytic rank 1.	[Qiu, Congling] Yale Univ, Dept Math, New Haven, CT 06511 USA	Yale University	Qiu, CL (corresponding author), Yale Univ, Dept Math, New Haven, CT 06511 USA.	congling.qiu@yale.edu			Morningside Center of Mathematics at Chinese Academy of Sciences; Institutes for Advanced Studies at Tsinghua University; NSF [DMS-2000533]	Morningside Center of Mathematics at Chinese Academy of Sciences; Institutes for Advanced Studies at Tsinghua University; NSF(National Science Foundation (NSF))	The author heartily thanks Shouwu Zhang for suggesting this problem, helpful discussions and constant encouragement. J	Gumenyuk, P; Roth, O				Gumenyuk, Pavel; Roth, Oliver			On the squeezing function for finitely connected planar domains	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							CANONICAL METRICS; MODULI SPACE; GEOMETRY	In a recent paper, Ng, Tang and Tsai (Math Ann 380, 1741-1766, https://doi.org/ 10. 1007/ s00208-020-02046- w, 2021) have found an explicit formula for the squeezing function of an annulus via the Loewner differential equation. Their result has led them to conjecture a corresponding formula for planar domains of any finite connectivity stating that the extremum in the squeezing function problem is achieved for a suitably chosen conformal mapping onto a circularly slit disk. In this paper we disprove this conjecture. We also give a conceptually simple potential-theoretic proof of the explicit formula for the squeezing function of an annulus which has the added advantage of identifying all extremal functions. J	Damanik, D; Guo, SZ; Ong, DC				Damanik, David; Guo, Shuzheng; Ong, Darren C.			Simon's OPUC Hausdorff dimension conjecture	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							SCHRODINGER-OPERATORS; SINGULAR SPECTRUM; THEOREM	We show that the Szego matrices, associated with Verblunsky coefficients {alpha(n)}(n is an element of Z+) obeying Sigma(infinity)(n=0) n(gamma) broken vertical bar alpha(2)(n broken vertical bar) < infinity for some gamma is an element of (0, 1), are bounded for values z is an element of partial derivative D outside a set of Hausdorff dimension no more than 1 - gamma. In particular, the singular part of the associated probability measure on the unit circle is supported by a set of Hausdorff dimension nomore than 1- gamma. This proves the OPUC Hausdorff dimension conjecture of Barry Simon from 2005.	[Damanik, David] Rice Univ, Dept Math, Houston, TX 77005 USA; [Guo, Shuzheng] Ocean Univ China, Sch Math Sci, Qingdao 266100, Shandong, Peoples R China; [Ong, Darren C.] Xiamen Univ Malaysia, Dept Math, Sepang 43900, Selangor Darul, Malaysia	Rice University; Ocean University of China; Xiamen University Malaysia Campus	Guo, SZ (corresponding author), Ocean Univ China, Sch Math Sci, Qingdao 266100, Shandong, Peoples R China.	damanik@rice.edu; gszou@gmail.com; darrenong@xmu.edu.my	Ong, Darren C/E-2482-2017	Ong, Darren C/0000-0003-4942-4376	Fundamental Research Grant Scheme from the Malaysian Ministry of Education [FRGS/1/2018/STG06/XMU/02/1]; Xiamen University Malaysia Research Fund [XMUMRF/2020-C5/IMAT/0011]; Simons Fellowship [669836]; NSF [DMS-1700131, DMS-2054752]; Alexander von Humboldt Foundation research award; NSFC [11571327]; CSC [201906330008]	Fundamental Research Grant Scheme from the Malaysian Ministry of Education; Xiamen University Malaysia Research Fund; Simons Fellowship; NSF(National Science Foundation (NSF)); Alexander von Humboldt Foundation research award(Alexander von Humboldt Foundation); NSFC(National Natural Science Foundation of China (NSFC)); CSC	D.O. was supported in part by a grant from the Fundamental Research Grant Scheme from the Malaysian Ministry of Education (Grant no. J	Gvirtz, D; Loughran, D; Nakahara, M				Gvirtz, Damian; Loughran, Daniel; Nakahara, Masahiro			Quantitative arithmetic of diagonal degree 2 K3 surfaces	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							HASSE PRINCIPLE; PERIODS	In this paper we study the existence of rational points for the family of K3 surfaces over Q given by w(2) = A(1)x(1)(6) + A(2)x(2)(6) + A(3)x(3)(6). When the coefficients are ordered by height, we show that the Brauer group is almost always trivial, and find the exact order of magnitude of surfaces for which there is a Brauer-Manin obstruction to the Hasse principle. Our results show definitively that K3 surfaces can have a Brauer-Manin obstruction to the Hasse principle that is only explained by odd order torsion. J	Mehmeti, V				Mehmeti, Vlere			Patching over analytic fibers and the local-global principle	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article						14G22; 11E08	HOMOGENEOUS SPACES; BERKOVICH SPACES	As a starting point for higher-dimensional patching in the Berkovich setting, we show that this technique is applicable around certain fibers of a relative Berkovich analytic curve. As a consequence, we prove a local-global principle over the field of overconvergent meromorphic functions on said fibers. By showing that these germs of meromorphic functions are algebraic, we also obtain local-global principles over function fields of algebraic curves defined over a class of (not necessarily complete) ultrametric fields, thus generalizing the results of Mehmeti(Compos Math 155:2399-2438, 2019).	[Mehmeti, Vlere] Univ Paris Saclay, Lab Mathemat Orsay, F-91405 Orsay, France	UDICE-French Research Universities; Universite Paris Saclay	Mehmeti, V (corresponding author), Univ Paris Saclay, Lab Mathemat Orsay, F-91405 Orsay, France.	vlere.mehmeti@u-psud.fr						Berkovich V.G., 1990, SPECTRAL THEORY ANAL, V33; AUG	2022	383	3-4					1825	1904		10.1007/s00208-021-02265-9	http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/s00208-021-02265-9		OCT 2021	80	Mathematics	Science Citation Index Expanded (SCI-EXPANDED)	Mathematics	3M4GT		Green Submitted			2022-12-19	WOS:000706035600001
J	Wang, JY				Wang, Juanyong			Structure of projective varieties with nef anticanonical divisor: the case of log terminal singularities	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							COMPACT KAHLER-MANIFOLDS; TRIVIAL CANONICAL CLASS; ALGEBRAIC FIBER SPACES; DECOMPOSITION THEOREM; KODAIRA DIMENSION; HERMITIAN METRICS; FUNDAMENTAL GROUP; MINIMAL MODELS; POSITIVITY; FINITENESS	In this article we study the structure of klt projective varieties with nef anticanonical divisor (and more generally, varieties of semi-Fano type), especially the canonical fibrations associated to them. We show that - The Albanese map for such variety is a locally constant fibration (that is, a locally trivial fibration such that X is isomorphic to the product of the universal cover of the Albanese torus by the fibre of the Albanese map quotient by a diagonal action of the fundamenatl group of the Albanese torus). - If the smooth locus is simply connected, the MRC fibration of such variety is an everywhere defined morphism and induces a decomposition of this variety into a product of a rationally connected variety by a projective variety with trivial canonical divisor. These generalize the corresponding results for smooth projective varieties with nef anticanonical bundle inCao (2019) and Cao-Horing (2019) to the klt case, and partially reduce the structure problem of these varieties to the singular Beauville-Bogomolov decomposition theorem proved by successive works of Greb-Kebekus-Peternell (2016), Druel (2018), Guenencia-Greb-Kebekus (2019) and Horing-Peternell (2019).	[Wang, Juanyong] Ecole Polytech, CMLS, F-91128 Palaiseau, France; [Wang, Juanyong] Chinese Acad Sci, Acad Math & Syst Sci, 55 Rd Zhongguancun, Beijing 100190, Peoples R China	Institut Polytechnique de Paris; Chinese Academy of Sciences	Wang, JY (corresponding author), Ecole Polytech, CMLS, F-91128 Palaiseau, France.; Wang, JY (corresponding author), Chinese Acad Sci, Acad Math & Syst Sci, 55 Rd Zhongguancun, Beijing 100190, Peoples R China.	juanyong.wang@amss.ac.cn			French 'Agence nationale de recherche' (ANR)	French 'Agence nationale de recherche' (ANR)(French National Research Agency (ANR))	The author would like to thank his thesis advisors Sebastien Boucksom and Junyan Cao for their enormous help to accomplish this work as well as to polish the presentation of the article. J	Chen, X; Kim, P; Wang, J				Chen, Xin; Kim, Panki; Wang, Jian			Two-sided Dirichlet heat kernel estimates of symmetric stable processes on horn-shaped regions	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article						Dirichlet heat kernel; Fractional Laplacian; Horn-shaped region; Levy system	INTRINSIC ULTRACONTRACTIVITY; SEMIGROUPS; OPERATORS	In this paper, we consider symmetric a-stable processes on (unbounded) horn-shaped regions which are non-uniformly C-1,C-1 near infinity. By using probabilistic approaches extensively, we establish two-sided Dirichlet heat kernel estimates of such processes for all time. The estimates are very sensitive with respect to the reference function corresponding to each horn-shaped region. Our results also cover the case that the associated Dirichlet semigroup is not intrinsically ultracontractive. A striking observation from our estimates is that, even when the associated Dirichlet semigroup is intrinsically ultracontractive, the so-called Varopoulos-type estimates do not hold in general for symmetric stable processes on horn-shaped regions. J	Otabe, S; Tonini, F; Zhang, L				Otabe, Shusuke; Tonini, Fabio; Zhang, Lei			A generalized Abhyankar's conjecture for simple Lie algebras in characteristic p > 5	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							AFFINE LINE; COVERINGS	In the present paper, we study a purely inseparable counterpart of Abhyankar's conjecture for the affine line in positive characteristic, and prove its validity for all the finite local non-abelian simple group schemes in characteristic p > 5. The crucial point is how to deal with finite local group schemes which cannot be realized as the Frobenius kernel of a smooth algebraic group. Such group schemes appear as the ones associated with Cartan type Lie algebras. We settle the problem for such Lie algebras by making use of natural gradations or filtrations on them.	[Otabe, Shusuke] Tokyo Denki Univ, Sch Engn, Dept Math, 5 Senju Asahi, Tokyo 1208551, Japan; [Tonini, Fabio] Univ Studi Firenze, Dipartimento Matemat & Informat Ulisse Dini, Viale Morgagni 67-A, I-50134 Florence, Italy; [Zhang, Lei] Chinese Univ Hong Kong, Dept Math, Hong Kong, Peoples R China	Tokyo Denki University; University of Florence; Chinese University of Hong Kong	Otabe, S (corresponding author), Tokyo Denki Univ, Sch Engn, Dept Math, 5 Senju Asahi, Tokyo 1208551, Japan.	shusuke.otabe@mail.dendai.ac.jp; fabio.tonini@unifi.it; lzhang@math.cuhk.edu.hk	Tonini, Fabio/AAC-9871-2022	Zhang, Lei/0000-0001-5451-8102; Otabe, Shusuke/0000-0003-2785-9774	JSPS Research Fellow [19J00366]; GNSAGA of INdAM; Research Grants Council (RGC) of the Hong Kong SAR China [CUHK 14301019]; CUHK [14301019]	JSPS Research Fellow(Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology, Japan (MEXT)Japan Society for the Promotion of Science); GNSAGA of INdAM(Istituto Nazionale di Alta Matematica (INDAM)); Research Grants Council (RGC) of the Hong Kong SAR China(Hong Kong Research Grants Council); CUHK(Chinese University of Hong Kong)	Themain result in the present paper is a partial answer to the question given by Dmitriy Rumynin after the first named author's talk at Max-Planck Institut fur Mathematik in Bonn, September 2018. J	Qin, HR				Qin, Hourong			Congruent numbers, quadratic forms and K-2	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							ELLIPTIC-CURVES; MODULAR-FORMS; 2-SYLOW SUBGROUP; LOCAL-DENSITIES; HEEGNER POINTS; CONJECTURE; FIELDS; BIRCH; KERNEL; PRIMES	We give a new and self-contained proof for an alternative form of Tunnell's theorem on congruent numbers. The proof relies on more knowledge on quadratic forms with less calculation than Tunnell's proof. The approach is based on our observation that the equality #{(x, y, z, w)epsilon Z(4)vertical bar p = 2x(2) + 3y(2) + 3z(2) + 4w(2) + 2yz} = #{(x, y, z)epsilon Z(3)vertical bar p2 = 2x(2)+ 4y(2)+ 9z(2) - 4yz} holds for any odd prime p. The same method is applied to the elliptic curves E-n : y(2) = x(3)+n(2)x and E-n : y(2) = x(x-n)(x+3n)(E-n : y(2) = x(x+ n)(x-3n))(p/3(2p/3)-congruent elliptic curves), wherewe list, without proof, the analogous results. Aseries of criteria for congruent numbers are given. In particular, for a prime p, we show that if p equivalent to 1 (mod 8) is a congruent number then the 8-rank of K2OQ(root p) equals one; if p equivalent to 1 (mod 16) with h(-p) not equivalent to h(-2p) (mod 16) then 2p is not a congruent number; and if p equivalent to 1, q equivalent to 3 (mod 8) are two primes with h(-pq) not equivalent to h(- p) (mod 8) then pq is not a congruent number.	[Qin, Hourong] Nanjing Univ, Dept Math, Nanjing 210093, Peoples R China	Nanjing University	Qin, HR (corresponding author), Nanjing Univ, Dept Math, Nanjing 210093, Peoples R China.	hrqin@nju.edu.cn						BARRUCAND P, 1969, J REINE ANGEW MATH, V238, P67; Bastein, 1915, INTERMEDIAIRE MATH, V22, P231; Birch B.J., 1970, S MATH, VIV, P27; BIRCH BJ, 1965, J REINE ANGEW MATH, V218, P79; CANDIOTTI A, 1989, ACTA ARITH, V52, P49, DOI 10.4064/aa-52-1-49-65; COATES J, 1977, INVENT MATH, V39, P223, DOI 10.1007/BF01402975; Coates JH, 2012, P NATL ACAD SCI USA, V109, P21182, DOI 10.1073/pnas.1219394110; Dickson LE., 1966, HIST THEORY NUMBERS; EARNEST AG, 1994, J LOND MATH SOC, V50, P222, DOI 10.1112/jlms/50.2.222; Feng KQ, 1996, ACTA ARITH, V75, P71; FLICKER YZ, 1980, INVENT MATH, V57, P119, DOI 10.1007/BF01390092; Fujiwara M, 1998, NUMBER THEORY, P235; GARLAND H, 1971, ANN MATH, V94, P534, DOI 10.2307/1970769; Goldfeld Dorian, 1979, NUMBER THEORY CARBON, V751, P108, DOI DOI 10.1007/BFB0062705; Gross B. J	Blomer, V; Corbett, A				Blomer, Valentin; Corbett, Andrew			A symplectic restriction problem	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article						Primary 11F37; 11F46; 11F67; 11F72	HALF-INTEGRAL WEIGHT; SIEGEL MODULAR-FORMS; FOURIER COEFFICIENTS; CUSP FORMS; GEODESIC RESTRICTIONS; MASS EQUIDISTRIBUTION; DIRICHLET SERIES; CLOSED GEODESICS; HEEGNER POINTS; MAASS FORMS	We investigate the norm of a degree 2 Siegel modular form of asymptotically large weight whose argument is restricted to the 3-dimensional subspace of its imaginary part. On average over Saito-Kurokawa lifts an asymptotic formula is established that is consistent with the mass equidistribution conjecture on the Siegel upper half space as well as the Lindelof hypothesis for the corresponding Koecher-Maass series. The ingredients include a new relative trace formula for pairs of Heegner periods. J	Kurkofka, J				Kurkofka, Jan			Every infinitely edge-connected graph contains the Farey graph or T-aleph 0* t as a minor	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article								We show that every infinitely edge-connected graph contains the Farey graph or T-aleph 0* t as a minor. These two graphs are unique with this property up to minor-equivalence. J	Kessler, E; Sheshmani, A; Yau, ST				Kessler, Enno; Sheshmani, Artan; Yau, Shing-Tung			Super J-holomorphic curves: construction of the moduli space	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							RIEMANN SURFACES; STACKS; MAPS	Let M be a super Riemann surface with holomorphic distribution D and N a symplectic manifold with compatible almost complex structure J. We call a map Phi : M -> N a super J-holomorphic curve if its differential maps the almost complex structure on D to J. Such a super J-holomorphic curve is a critical point for the superconformal action and satisfies a super differential equation of first order. Using component fields of this super differential equation and a transversality argument we construct the moduli space of super J-holomorphic curves as a smooth subsupermanifold of the space of maps M -> N.	[Kessler, Enno; Sheshmani, Artan; Yau, Shing-Tung] Harvard Univ, Ctr Math Sci & Applicat, 20 Garden St, Cambridge, MA 02138 USA; [Sheshmani, Artan] Aarhus Univ, Dept Math, Ny Munkegade 118, DK-8000 Aarhus C, Denmark; [Sheshmani, Artan] Natl Res Univ Higher Sch Econ, Lab Mirror Symmetry, NRU HSE, 6 Usacheva St, Moscow 119048, Russia; [Yau, Shing-Tung] Harvard Univ, Dept Math, Cambridge, MA 02138 USA	Harvard University; Aarhus University; HSE University (National Research University Higher School of Economics); Harvard University	Kessler, E (corresponding author), Harvard Univ, Ctr Math Sci & Applicat, 20 Garden St, Cambridge, MA 02138 USA.	ek@cmsa.fas.harvard.edu; artan@cmsa.fas.harvard.edu; yau@math.harvard.edu		Sheshmani, Artan/0000-0003-3241-0576; Kessler, Enno/0000-0002-0613-6596	Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft Research Fellowship [KE2324/1-1]; NSF [DMS-1607871, PHY-1306313]; Simons [38558]; Laboratory of Mirror Symmetry NRU HSE, RF Government grant [14.641.31.0001]	Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft Research Fellowship(German Research Foundation (DFG)); NSF(National Science Foundation (NSF)); Simons; Laboratory of Mirror Symmetry NRU HSE, RF Government grant	Enno Kessler was supported by a Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft Research Fellowship, KE2324/1-1. J	Gianazza, U; Liao, N				Gianazza, Ugo; Liao, Naian			Continuity of the temperature in a multi-phase transition problem	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article; Early Access						35B65; 35K65; 35K92; 80A22	WEAK SOLUTIONS; REGULARITY; BEHAVIOR; MODULUS	Locally bounded, local weak solutions to a doubly nonlinear parabolic equation, which models the multi-phase transition of a material, is shown to be locally continuous. J	Brandenbursky, M; Marcinkowski, M				Brandenbursky, Michael; Marcinkowski, Michal			Bounded cohomology of transformation groups	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							FOLIATED SURFACE BUNDLES; DIFFEOMORPHISMS; INVARIANTS; GEOMETRY	Let M be a complete connected Riemannian manifold of finite volume. We present a new method of constructing classes in bounded cohomology of transformation groups such as Homeo(0)(M, mu), Diff(0)(M, vol) and Symp(0)(M, omega). As an application we show that for many manifolds (in particular for hyperbolic surfaces) the third bounded cohomology of these groups is infinite dimensional. J	Liu, BY; Zhang, Q				Liu, Baiying; Zhang, Qing			On a converse theorem for G(2) over finite fields	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							FOURIER-JACOBI MODELS; REDUCTIVE GROUPS; GAMMA FACTORS; UNIPOTENT SUPPORT; REPRESENTATIONS; CONJECTURE; UNIQUENESS; GL(N)	In this paper, we prove certain multiplicity one theorems and define twisted gamma factors for irreducible generic cuspidal representations of split G(2) over finite fields k of odd characteristic. J	Machado, S				Machado, Simon			Infinite approximate subgroups of soluble Lie groups	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article						Approximate lattices; Approximate subgroups; Lie groups; Linear algebraic groups	GROWTH	We study infinite approximate subgroups of soluble Lie groups. We show that approximate subgroups are close, in a sense to be defined, to genuine connected subgroups. Building upon this result we prove a structure theorem for approximate lattices in soluble Lie groups. This extends to soluble Lie groups a theorem about quasi-crystals due to Yves Meyer. J	Suzuki, Y				Suzuki, Yuhei			Non-amenable tight squeezes by Kirchberg algebras	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							C-ASTERISK-ALGEBRAS; REDUCED CROSSED-PRODUCTS; VON-NEUMANN-ALGEBRAS; INJECTIVE ENVELOPES; K-THEORY; SUBALGEBRAS; NUCLEAR; RANK; AUTOMORPHISMS; AMENABILITY	We give a framework to produce C*-algebra inclusions with extreme properties. This gives the first constructive nuclear minimal ambient C*-algebras. We further obtain a purely infinite analogue of Dadarlat's modeling theorem on AF-algebras: Every Kirchberg algebra is rigidly and KK-equivalently sandwiched by non-nuclear C*algebras without intermediate C*-algebras. Finally we reveal a novel property of Kirchberg algebras: They embed into arbitrarily wild C*-algebras as rigid maximal C*-subalgebras. J	Abardia-Evequoz, J; Bernig, A				Abardia-Evequoz, Judit; Bernig, Andreas			Additive kinematic formulas for flag area measures	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							TRANSLATION INVARIANT VALUATIONS; INTEGRAL GEOMETRY; SPACE	We show the existence of additive kinematic formulas for general flag area measures, which generalizes a recent result by Wannerer. Building on previous work by the second named author, we introduce an algebraic framework to compute these formulas explicitly. This is carried out in detail in the case of the incomplete flag manifold consisting of all (p + 1)-planes containing a unit vector. J	Flapan, L				Flapan, Laure			Complete families of indecomposable non-simple abelian varieties	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							COMPLETE CURVES; BUNDLES	Given a fixed product of non-isogenous abelian varieties at least one of which is general, we show how to construct complete families of indecomposable abelian varieties whose very general fiber is isogenous to the given product and whose connected monodromy group is a product of symplectic groups or is a unitary group. As a consequence, we show how to realize any product of symplectic groups of total rank g as the connected monodromy group of a complete family of g '-dimensional abelian varieties for any g ' >= g. These methods also yield a construction of a new Kodaira fibration with fiber genus 4. J	Codogni, G; Kramer, T				Codogni, Giulio; Kramer, Thomas			Semicontinuity of Gauss maps and the Schottky problem	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article						Primary 14K12; Secondary 14C17; 14F10; 14H42	WHITNEY STRATIFICATIONS; ABELIAN-VARIETIES; THETA DIVISORS; CHERN CLASSES; THEOREM; SUBVARIETIES; GEOMETRY; TOPOLOGY; SHEAVES	We show that the degree of Gauss maps on abelian varieties is semicontinuous in families, and we study its jump loci. As an application we obtain that in the case of theta divisors this degree answers the Schottky problem. Our proof computes the degree of Gauss maps by specialization of Lagrangian cycles on the cotangent bundle. We also get similar results for the intersection cohomology of varieties with a finite morphism to an abelian variety; it follows that many components of Andreotti-Mayer loci, including the Schottky locus, are part of the stratification of the moduli space of ppav's defined by the topological type of the theta divisor. J	Krietenstein, T; Schrohe, E				Krietenstein, Thorben; Schrohe, Elmar			Bounded H-infinity-calculus for a degenerate elliptic boundary value problem	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							L-P-REGULARITY; TRACE EXPANSIONS; MANIFOLDS; LAPLACIAN; OPERATORS	On a manifold X with boundary and bounded geometry we consider a strongly elliptic second order operator A together with a degenerate boundary operator T of the form T=phi(0)gamma(0)+phi(1)gamma(1). Here gamma(0) and gamma(1) denote the evaluation of a function and its exterior normal derivative, respectively, at the boundary. We assume that phi(0),phi(1) >= 0, and phi(0)+phi(1) >= c, for some c > 0, where either phi(0),phi(1) is an element of C-b(infinity)(partial derivative X) or phi(0) = 1 and phi(1) = phi(2) for some phi is an element of C2+tau(partial derivative X), tau > 0. We also assume that the highest order coefficients of A belong to C-tau(X) and the lower order coefficients are in L-infinity(X). We show that the L-p(X)-realization of A with respect to the boundary operator T has a bounded H-infinity-calculus. We then obtain the unique solvability of the associated boundary value problem in adapted spaces. As an application, we show the short time existence of solutions to the porous medium equation.	[Krietenstein, Thorben; Schrohe, Elmar] Leibniz Univ Hannover, Inst Anal, Welfengarten 1, D-30167 Hannover, Germany	Leibniz University Hannover	Schrohe, E (corresponding author), Leibniz Univ Hannover, Inst Anal, Welfengarten 1, D-30167 Hannover, Germany.	krietenstein@math.uni-hannover.de; schrohe@math.uni-hannover.de			Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft through the research training group GRK 1463	Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft through the research training group GRK 1463(German Research Foundation (DFG))	The results in this article are based on the second author's thesis, see [26]. J	Fan, Y				Fan, Yue			The orbit type stratification of the moduli space of Higgs bundles	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							REDUCTION	The moduli space of Higgs bundles can be constructed as a quotient of an infinite-dimensional space and hence admits an orbit type decomposition. In this paper, we show that the orbit type decomposition is a complex Whitney stratification such that each stratum is a complex symplectic submanifold and hence admits a complex Poisson bracket. Moreover, these Poisson brackets glue to a Poisson bracket on the structure sheaf of the moduli space so that the moduli space is a stratified complex symplectic space. J	Ishimoto, H				Ishimoto, Hiroshi			Proofs of Ibukiyama's conjectures on Siegel modular forms of half-integral weight and of degree 2	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article						Vector valued Siegel cusp forms of half-integral weight; Metaplectic groups; Jacobi forms; Jacobi groups	REPRESENTATIONS	We prove Ibukiyama's conjectures on Siegel modular forms of half-integral weight and of degree 2 by using Arthur's multiplicity formula on the split odd special orthogonal group SO5 and Gan-Ichino's multiplicity formula on the metaplectic group Mp(4). J	McDonald, E; Sukochev, F				McDonald, Edward; Sukochev, Fedor			Lipschitz estimates in quasi-Banach Schatten ideals	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							ABSOLUTE VALUE; CONTINUITY; OPERATORS; WAVELETS	We study the class of functions f on R satisfying a Lipschitz estimate in the Schatten ideal L-p for 0 < p <= 1. The corresponding problem with p >= 1 has been extensively studied, but the quasi-Banach range 0 < p < 1 is by comparison poorly understood. Using techniques from wavelet analysis, we prove that Lipschitz functions belonging to the homogeneous Besov class. Bp/1- p, (p) (1/p) (R) obey the estimate parallel to f ( A) - f (B)parallel to (p) <= C-p( parallel to f'parallel to L-infinity (R) + parallel to f parallel to (1/p)(<(B)over dot>p/1- p, p) ((R)) ) parallel to A - B parallel to(p) for all bounded self-adjoint operators A and B with A-B is an element of L-p. In the case p = 1, our methods recover and provide a new perspective on a result of Peller that f is an element of <(B)over dot>(1)(infinity,1) is sufficient for a function to be Lipschitz in L-1. We also provide related Holdertype estimates, extending results of Aleksandrov and Peller. In addition, we prove the surprising fact that non-constant periodic functions on R are not Lipschitz in L-p for any 0 < p < 1. This gives counterexamples to a 1991 conjecture of Peller that f is an element of <(B)over dot>(1/ p)(infinity,p) (R) is sufficient for f to be Lipschitz in L-p. J	Zach, M				Zach, Matthias			A generalization of Milnor's formula	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							EULER OBSTRUCTION; CHERN CLASSES; INDEX	The Milnor number mu(f) of a holomorphic function f : (C-n, 0) -> (C, 0) with an isolated singularity has several different characterizations as, for example: 1) the number of critical points in a morsification of f, 2) the middle Betti number of its Milnor fiber M-f, 3) the degree of the differential d(f) at the origin, and 4) the length of an analytic algebra due to Milnor's formula mu(f) = dim(C) O-n/Jac(f). Let (X, 0) subset of (C-n, 0) be an arbitrarily singular reduced analytic space, endowed with its canonical Whitney stratification and let f : (C-n, 0) -> (C, 0) be a holomorphic function whose restriction f vertical bar(X, 0) has an isolated singularity in the stratified sense. For each stratum S-alpha let mu(f) (alpha; X, 0) be the number of critical points on S-alpha in a morsification of f vertical bar(X, 0). We showthat the numbers mu f (alpha; X, 0) generalize the classical Milnor number in all of the four characterizations above. To this end, we describe a homology decomposition of the Milnor fiber M-f vertical bar(X,M-0) in terms of the mu(f) (alpha; X, 0) and introduce a newhomological index which computes these numbers directly as a holomorphic Euler characteristic. We furthermore give an algorithm for this computation when the closure of the stratum is a hypersurface. J	Boggi, M; Looijenga, E				Boggi, Marco; Looijenga, Eduard			Curves with prescribed symmetry and associated representations of mapping class groups	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							ABELIAN-VARIETIES; QUOTIENTS; COVERS	Let C be a complex smooth projective algebraic curve endowed with an action of a finite group G such that the quotient curve has genus at least 3. We prove that if the G-curve C is very general for these properties, then the natural map from the group algebra QG to the algebra of Q-endomorphisms of its Jacobian is an isomorphism. We use this to obtain (topological) properties regarding certain virtual linear representations of a mapping class group. For example, we show that the connected component of the Zariski closure of such a representation often acts Q-irreducibly in a G-isogeny space of H-1 (C; Q) and with image a Q-almost simple group. J	Hochs, P; Song, YL; Tang, X				Hochs, Peter; Song, Yanli; Tang, Xiang			An index theorem for higher orbital integrals	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							IRREDUCIBLE TEMPERED REPRESENTATIONS; PROPER ACTIONS; DISCRETE-SERIES; K-THEORY; CLASSIFICATION; RESTRICTION; CONJECTURE; L2-INDEX; OPERATOR	Recently, two of the authors of this paper constructed cyclic cocycles on Harish-Chandra's Schwartz algebra of linear reductive Lie groups that detect all information in the K-theory of the corresponding group C*-algebra. J	Saroglou, C				Saroglou, Christos			On a non-homogeneous version of a problem of Firey	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							GAUSS CURVATURE FLOW; P-MINKOWSKI PROBLEM; HYPERSURFACES; REGULARITY; SHAPES	We investigate the uniqueness for the Monge-Ampere type equation det(u(ij) + delta(ij)u)(i,j=1)(n-1) = G(u), on Sn-1, (1) where u is the restriction of the support function on the sphere Sn-1, of a convex body that contains the origin in its interior and G : (0, infinity) -> (0, infinity) is a continuous function. The problem was initiated by Firey (Mathematika 21(1): 1-11, 1974) who, in the case G(theta) = theta(-1), asked if u equivalent to 1 is the unique solution to (1). Recently, Brendle et al. (Acta Mathe 219(1): 1-16, 2017) proved that if G(theta) = theta(-p), p > -n - 1, then u has to be constant, providing in particular a complete solution to Firey's problem. Our primary goal is to obtain uniqueness (or nearly uniqueness) results for (1) for a broader family of functions G. Our approach is very different than the techniques developed in Brendle et al. (2017).	[Saroglou, Christos] Univ Ioannina, Dept Math, Ioannina 45110, Greece	University of Ioannina	Saroglou, C (corresponding author), Univ Ioannina, Dept Math, Ioannina 45110, Greece.	csaroglou@uoi.gr						Andrews B, 2000, PAC J MATH, V195, P1, DOI 10.2140/pjm.2000.195.1; J	Abad, CA				Arias Abad, Camilo			Singular chains on Lie groups and the Cartan relations I	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article								Let G be a simply connected Lie group with Lie algebra g. We show that the following categories are naturally equivalent. The category Mod(C.( G)) of sufficiently smooth modules over the DG algebra of singular chains on G. The category Rep(Tg) of representations of the DG Lie algebra Tg, which is universal for the Cartan relations. This equivalence extends the correspondence between representations of G and representations of g. In a companion paper, we will show that in the compact case, the equivalence can be extended to a quasi-equivalence of DG categories. J	Collins, TC; Guo, B; Tong, F				Collins, Tristan C.; Guo, Bin; Tong, Freid			On the degeneration of asymptotically conical Calabi-Yau metrics	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							FLAT KAHLER-METRICS; SASAKI-EINSTEIN METRICS; RICCI CURVATURE; CREPANT RESOLUTIONS; COMPLEX-SURFACES; MANIFOLDS; SPACES; EXISTENCE; LIMITS	We study the degenerations of asymptotically conical Ricci-flat Kahler metrics as the Kahler class degenerates to a semi-positive class. We show that under appropriate assumptions, the Ricci-flat Kahler metrics converge to a incomplete smooth Ricci-flat Kahler metric away from a compact subvariety. As a consequence, we construct singular Calabi-Yau metrics with asymptotically conical behaviour at infinity on certain quasi-projective varieties and we show that the metric geometry of these singular metrics are homeomorphic to the topology of the singular variety. Finally, we will apply our results to study several classes of examples of geometric transitions between Calabi-Yau manifolds. J	Ren, RF; Zhao, B				Ren, Rufei; Zhao, Bin			Spectral halo for Hilbert modular forms	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							EIGENCURVE; BOUNDARY	Let F be a totally real field and p be an odd prime which splits completely in F. We prove that the eigenvariety associated to a definite quaternion algebra over F satisfies the following property: over a boundary annulus of the weight space, the eigenvariety is a disjoint union of countably infinitely many connected components which are finite over the weight space; on each fixed connected component, the ratios between the U-p-slopes of points and the p-adic valuations of the p-parameters are bounded by explicit numbers, for all primes p of F over p. Applying Hansen's p-adic interpolation theorem, we are able to transfer our results to Hilbert modular eigenvarieties. In particular, we prove that on every irreducible component of Hilbert modular eigenvarieties, as a point moves towards the boundary, its U-p slope goes to zero. In the case of eigencurves, this completes the proof of Coleman-Mazur's 'halo' conjecture. J	Imekraz, R; Ouhabaz, E				Imekraz, Rafik; Ouhabaz, El Maati			Bernstein inequalities via the heat semigroup	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							RIESZ TRANSFORMS; SCHRODINGER-OPERATORS; KERNEL; DERIVATIVES; MANIFOLDS	We extend the classical Bernstein inequality to a general setting including the Laplace-Beltrami operator, Schrodinger operators and divergence form elliptic operators on Riemannian manifolds or domains. We prove L-p Bernstein inqualities as well as a "reverse inequality" which is neweven for compact manifolds (with or without boundary). Such a reverse inequality can be seen as the dual of the Bernstein inequality. The heat kernel will be the backbone of our approach but we also develop new techniques. For example, once reformulating Bernstein inequalities in a semi-classical fashion we prove and use weak factorization of smooth functions a la Dixmier-Malliavin and BMO-L-infinity multiplier results (in contrast to the usual L-infinity-BMO ones). Also, our approach reveals a link between the L-p-Bernsteinin equality and the boundedness on L-p of the Riesz transform.	[Imekraz, Rafik; Ouhabaz, El Maati] Univ Bordeaux, Inst Math IMB, CNRS UMR 5251, 351 Cours Liberat, F-33405 Talence, France	Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique (CNRS); CNRS - National Institute for Mathematical Sciences (INSMI); UDICE-French Research Universities; Universite de Bordeaux	Ouhabaz, E (corresponding author), Univ Bordeaux, Inst Math IMB, CNRS UMR 5251, 351 Cours Liberat, F-33405 Talence, France. J	Keating, A				Keating, Ailsa			Families of monotone Lagrangians in Brieskorn-Pham hypersurfaces	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							HOLOMORPHIC-CURVES; MIRROR SYMMETRY; TORI; SUBMANIFOLDS; HOMOLOGY; ISOTOPY	We present techniques, inspired by monodromy considerations, for constructing compact monotone Lagrangians in certain affine hypersurfaces, chiefly of Brieskorn-Pham type. We focus on dimensions 2 and 3, though the constructions generalise to higher ones. The techniques give significant latitude in controlling the homology class, Maslov class and monotonicity constant of the Lagrangian, and a range of possible diffeomorphism types; they are also explicit enough to be amenable to calculations of pseudo-holomorphic curve invariants. Applications include infinite families of monotone Lagrangian S-1 x Sigma(g) in C-3, distinguished by soft invariants for any genus g >= 2; and, for fixed soft invariants, a range of infinite families of Lagrangians in Brieskorn-Pham hypersurfaces. These are generally distinct up to Hamiltonian isotopy. In specific cases, we also set up well-defined counts of Maslov zero holomorphic annuli, which distinguish the Lagrangians up to compactly supported symplectomorphisms. Inter alia, these give families of exact monotone Lagrangian tori which are related neither by geometric mutation nor by compactly supported symplectomorphisms.	[Keating, Ailsa] Univ Cambridge, Cambridge, England	University of Cambridge	Keating, A (corresponding author), Univ Cambridge, Cambridge, England.	amk50@cam.ac.uk			Simons Foundation; NSF [DMS-1505798, DMS-1128155]; Trinity College, Cambridge	Simons Foundation; NSF(National Science Foundation (NSF)); Trinity College, Cambridge	This project is inspired by earlier attempts, joint with Mohammed Abouzaid, to generaliseAuroux' result [6] to Lagrangian S1x ~gs inC3. In particular, many thanks to Abouzaid for suggesting using holomorphic annuli, and for discussions of technical difficulties which might arise when trying to get a well-defined invariant out of them. The author learnt Theorem 4.1 from Henry Wilton, and Lemma 3.11 from Oscar Randal-Williams. Many thanks also to Roger Casals for discussions of [29] and feedback on earlier versions of this project; Georgios Dimitroglou-Rizell for discussions related to Remark 4.3; Tobias Ekhlom for discussions relating to counts of holomorphic annuli; Jonathan Evans for discussions relating to his joint work [19]; Melissa Liu for explanations of her thesis [35]; and Ivan Smith for feedback on an earlier version of this article. J	Kostianko, A; Sun, CY; Zelik, S				Kostianko, Anna; Sun, Chunyou; Zelik, Sergey			Reaction-diffusion systems with supercritical nonlinearities revisited	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							FINITE-DIMENSIONAL ATTRACTORS; EXPONENTIAL ATTRACTORS; EQUATIONS; DYNAMICS; BLOW; WEAK	We give a comprehensive study of the analytic properties and long-time behavior of solutions of a reaction-diffusion system in a bounded domain in the case where the nonlinearity satisfies the standardmonotonicity assumption. We pay themain attention to the supercritical case, where the nonlinearity is not subordinated to the linear part of the equation trying to put as small as possible amount of extra restrictions on this nonlinearity. The properties of such systems in the supercritical case may be very different in comparison with the standard case of subordinated nonlinearities. We examine the global existence and uniqueness of weak and strong solutions, various types of smoothing properties, asymptotic compactness and the existence of global and exponential attractors.	[Kostianko, Anna; Sun, Chunyou; Zelik, Sergey] Lanzhou Univ, Sch Math & Stat, Lanzhou 730000, Peoples R China; [Kostianko, Anna; Zelik, Sergey] Univ Surrey, Dept Math, Guildford GU2 7XH, Surrey, England; [Zelik, Sergey] Keldysh Inst Appl Math, Moscow, Russia	Lanzhou University; University of Surrey; Russian Academy of Sciences; Keldysh Institute of Applied Mathematics	Zelik, S (corresponding author), Lanzhou Univ, Sch Math & Stat, Lanzhou 730000, Peoples R China.; Zelik, S (corresponding author), Univ Surrey, Dept Math, Guildford GU2 7XH, Surrey, England.; Zelik, S (corresponding author), Keldysh Inst Appl Math, Moscow, Russia.	anna.kostianko@surrey.ac.uk; sunchy@lzu.edu.cn; s.zelik@surrey.ac.uk	Zelik, Sergey/AAS-3031-2021; Zelik, Sergey/AAW-7982-2021; Zelik, Sergey/GRJ-7152-2022	Zelik, Sergey/0000-0002-4884-5040; Zelik, Sergey/0000-0002-4884-5040; 	RSF [19-71-30004]; EPSRC [EP/P024920/1]; NSFC [11471148, 11522109, 11871169]	RSF(Russian Science Foundation (RSF)); EPSRC(UK Research & Innovation (UKRI)Engineering & Physical Sciences Research Council (EPSRC)); NSFC(National Natural Science Foundation of China (NSFC))	This work is partially supported by the RSF grant 19-71-30004 as well as the EPSRC grant EP/P024920/1 and NSFC grants No. 11471148, 11522109, 11871169. J	Hwang, JM; Neusser, K				Hwang, Jun-Muk; Neusser, Katharina			Cone structures and parabolic geometries	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article						Cone structures; Rational homogeneous space; Varieties of minimal rational tangents; Cartan connections; Parabolic geometry; Filtered manifolds	SPACES	A cone structure on a complex manifold M is a closed submanifold C subset of PTM of the projectivized tangent bundle which is submersive over M. A conic connection on C specifies a distinguished family of curves on M in the directions specified by C. There are two common sources of cone structures and conic connections, one in differential geometry and another in algebraic geometry. In differential geometry, we have cone structures induced by the geometric structures underlying holomorphic parabolic geometries, a classical example of which is the null cone bundle of a holomorphic conformal structure. In algebraic geometry, we have the cone structures consisting of varieties of minimal rational tangents (VMRT) given by minimal rational curves on uniruled projective manifolds. The local invariants of the cone structures in parabolic geometries are given by the curvature of the parabolic geometries, the nature of which depend on the type of the parabolic geometry, i.e., the type of the fibers of C -> M. For the VMRT-structures, more intrinsic invariants of the conic connections which do not depend on the type of the fiber play important roles. We study the relation between these two different aspects for the cone structures induced by parabolic geometries associated with a long simple root of a complex simple Lie algebra. As an application, we obtain a local differential-geometric version of the global algebraic-geometric recognition theorem due to Mok and Hong-Hwang. In our local version, the role of rational curves is completely replaced by appropriate torsion conditions on the conic connection.	[Hwang, Jun-Muk] Inst for Basic Sci Korea, Ctr Complex Geometry, B275,55 EXPO Ro, Daejeon, South Korea; [Neusser, Katharina] Masaryk Univ, Dept Math & Stat, Kotlarska 267-2, Brno 61137, Czech Republic	Institute for Basic Science - Korea (IBS); Masaryk University Brno	Neusser, K (corresponding author), Masaryk Univ, Dept Math & Stat, Kotlarska 267-2, Brno 61137, Czech Republic.	jmhwang@ibs.re.kr; neusser@math.muni.cz	Neusser, Katharina/AAF-7232-2021	Neusser, Katharina/0000-0002-7256-1873	Institute for Basic Science [IBS-R032-D1]; Czech Science foundation [GX19-28628X]	Institute for Basic Science; Czech Science foundation(Grant Agency of the Czech Republic)	The authors would like to thank Andreas C. ap for helpful discussions, in particular about the invariant.F, and the referee for helpful suggestions to improve the presentation. The second author was supported by the grant GX19-28628X of the Czech Science foundation and acknowledges the hospitality of the Korea Institute for Advanced Study. J	Patakfalvi, Z; Zdanowicz, M				Patakfalvi, Zsolt; Zdanowicz, Maciej			Ordinary varieties with trivial canonical bundle are not uniruled	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							COHOMOLOGY; SINGULARITIES	We prove that smooth, projective, K-trivial, weakly ordinary varieties over a perfect field of characteristic p > 0 are not geometrically uniruled. We also show a singular version of our theorem, which is sharp in multiple aspects. Our work, together with Langer's results, implies that varieties of the above type have strongly semistable tangent bundles with respect to every polarization. J	Amann, M; Lange, C; Radeschi, M				Amann, Manuel; Lange, Christian; Radeschi, Marco			Odd-dimensional orbifolds with all geodesics closed are covered by manifolds	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							COHOMOLOGY	Manifolds all of whose geodesics are closed have been studied a lot, but there are only few examples known. The situation is different if one allows in addition for orbifold singularities. We show, nevertheless, that the abundance of new examples is restricted to even dimensions. As one key ingredient we provide a characterization of orientable manifolds among orientable orbifolds in terms of characteristic classes.	[Amann, Manuel] Univ Augsburg, Differentialgeometrie, Inst Math, Univ Str 14, D-86159 Augsburg, Germany; [Lange, Christian] Univ Munich, Math Inst, Theresienstr 39, D-80333 Munich, Germany; [Radeschi, Marco] Univ Notre Dame, Dept Math, 255 Hurley, Notre Dame, IN 46556 USA	University of Augsburg; University of Munich; University of Notre Dame	Lange, C (corresponding author), Univ Munich, Math Inst, Theresienstr 39, D-80333 Munich, Germany.	manuel.amann@math.uni-augsburg.de; lange@math.lmu.de; mradesch@nd.edu	Radeschi, Marco/AAE-5315-2020	Radeschi, Marco/0000-0001-6167-7136	Projekt DEAL; Heisenberg grant; German Research Foundation [AM 342/4-1]; DFG [2026, SFB/TRR 191]; NSF [DMS-1810913]	Projekt DEAL; Heisenberg grant(German Research Foundation (DFG)); German Research Foundation(German Research Foundation (DFG)); DFG(German Research Foundation (DFG)); NSF(National Science Foundation (NSF))	Open Access funding enabled and organized by Projekt DEAL. J	Murakami, T				Murakami, Takuya			On Hoffman's t-values of maximal height and generators of multiple zeta values	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							MIXED TATE MOTIVES	We prove that any multiple t-value of maximal height (that is, all components of the index are greater than 1) can be written as a rational linear combination of multiple zeta values by using Glanois's theorem. We also prove that each multiple zeta value is a Q-linear combination of multiple t-values where all components of the index are 2 or 3. Further, we prove some results on multiple T-values, as conjectured by Kaneko-Tsumura. J	Dinh, TC; Oguiso, K; Yu, X				Tien-Cuong Dinh; Oguiso, Keiji; Yu, Xun			Smooth rational projective varieties with non-finitely generated discrete automorphism group and infinitely many real forms	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article								We show, among other things, that for each integer n >= 3, there is a smooth complex projective rational variety of dimension n, with discrete non-finitely generated automorphism group and with infinitely many mutually non-isomorphic real forms. Our result is inspired by the work of Lesieutre and the work of Dinh and Oguiso. J	Stanojkovski, M; Voll, C				Stanojkovski, Mima; Voll, Christopher			Hessian matrices, automorphisms of p-groups, and torsion points of elliptic curves	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article; Early Access						20D15; 11G20; 14M12	ZETA-FUNCTIONS; SUBGROUPS	We describe the automorphism groups of finite p-groups arising naturally via Hessian determinantal representations of elliptic curves defined over number fields. Moreover, we derive explicit formulas for the orders of these automorphism groups for elliptic curves of j-invariant 1728 given in Weierstrass form. We interpret these orders in terms of the numbers of 3-torsion points (or flex points) of the relevant curves over finite fields. Our work greatly generalizes and conceptualizes previous examples given by du Sautoy and Vaughan-Lee. It explains, in particular, why the orders arising in these examples are polynomial on Frobenius sets and vary with the primes in a nonquasipolynomial manner. J	Schwend, J; Stovall, B				Schwend, Jeremy; Stovall, Betsy			Fourier restriction above rectangles	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							BILINEAR APPROACH; HYPERSURFACES; TRANSFORM	In this article, we study the problem of obtaining Lebesgue space inequalities for the Fourier restriction operator associated to rectangular pieces of the paraboloid and perturbations thereof. We state a conjecture for the dependence of the operator norms in these inequalities on the sidelengths of the rectangles, prove that this conjecture follows from (a slight reformulation of the) restriction conjecture for elliptic hypersurfaces, and prove that, if valid, the conjecture is essentially sharp. Such questions arise naturally in the study of restriction inequalities for degenerate hypersurfaces; we demonstrate this connection by using our positive results to prove new restriction inequalities for a class of hypersurfaces having some additive structure.	[Schwend, Jeremy] Univ Georgia, Dept Math, Athens, GA 30602 USA; [Stovall, Betsy] Univ Wisconsin, Dept Math, Madison, WI 53706 USA	University System of Georgia; University of Georgia; University of Wisconsin System; University of Wisconsin Madison	Stovall, B (corresponding author), Univ Wisconsin, Dept Math, Madison, WI 53706 USA. J	Suciu, AI				Suciu, Alexander I.			Sigma-invariants and tropical varieties	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							COHOMOLOGY JUMP LOCI; HOMOLOGICAL FINITENESS; GEOMETRIC INVARIANTS; GENERAL TYPE; VALUATIONS; ALEXANDER; CLASSIFICATION; MANIFOLDS; MULTINETS; TOPOLOGY	The Bieri-Neumann-Strebel-Renz invariants Sigma(q) (X, Z) subset of H-1( X, R) of a connected, finite-type CW-complex X are the vanishing loci for Novikov-Sikorav homology in degrees up to q, while the characteristic varieties V-q (X) subset of H-1(X, C-x) are the nonvanishing loci for homology with coefficients in rank 1 local systems in degree q. We show that each BNSR invariant Sigma(q) (X, Z) is contained in the complement of the tropical variety associated to the algebraic variety V-<= q (X), and provide applications to several classes of groups and spaces. J	de la Breteche, R; Fiorilli, D				Breteche, Regis de la; Fiorilli, Daniel			On a conjecture of Montgomery and Soundararajan	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							PAIR CORRELATION; 2ND MOMENT; PRIMES; SUMS	We establish lower bounds for all weighted even moments of primes up to X in intervals which are in agreement with a conjecture of Montgomery and Soundararajan. Our bounds hold unconditionally for an unbounded set of values of X, and hold for all X under the Riemann Hypothesis. We also deduce new unconditional Omega-results for the classical prime counting function. J	Liu, YJ				Liu, Yanjun			Anisotropic Trudinger-Moser inequalities associated with the exact growth in R-N and its maximizers	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							ADAMS-TYPE INEQUALITIES; EXTREMAL-FUNCTIONS; UNBOUNDED-DOMAINS; ELLIPTIC-EQUATIONS; EXISTENCE; NONEXISTENCE; SPACES	In this paper, suppose F : R-N -> [0, +infinity) be a convex function of class C-2(R-N\{0}) which is even and positively homogeneous of degree 1. Firstly, we derive anisotropic Trudinger-Moser inequality with exact growth in R-N, i.e., for any b > 0, there exists a constant C-N,C- b > 0 such that integral(RN)phi(N)(lambda vertical bar u vertical bar(N/N-1))/1+b vertical bar u vertical bar(N/N-1)dx <= C-N,C-b parallel to u parallel to(N)(N), for all u is an element of W-1,W-N(R-N) with integral F-RN(N)(del u)dx <= 1, where phi(N)(t) := e(t) - Sigma(N-2)(k=0)t(k)/k! , lambda <= lambda(N) = NN/N-1 kappa(1/N-1)(N) and kappa(N) is the volume of a unit Wulff ball in R-N. Moreover, this inequality fails if the power N/N-1 is replaced by any p < N/N-1. Secondly, we calculate the exact values of the supremums and give some results about nonexistence and existence of maximizers. Finally, we prove that anisotropic Trudinger-Moser inequality with the exact growth implies Trudinger-Moser inequality in W-1,W-N(R-N).	[Liu, Yanjun] Chongqing Normal Univ, Sch Math Sci, Chongqing 401131, Peoples R China; [Liu, Yanjun] Nankai Univ, Sch Math Sci, Tianjin 300071, Peoples R China	Chongqing Normal University; Nankai University	Liu, YJ (corresponding author), Chongqing Normal Univ, Sch Math Sci, Chongqing 401131, Peoples R China.; Liu, YJ (corresponding author), Nankai Univ, Sch Math Sci, Tianjin 300071, Peoples R China.	liuyj@mail.nankai.edu.cn	刘, 严君/GZL-5764-2022; liu, yan/HGV-1365-2022; liu, yan/HCI-5542-2022		CSC [2019062400056]	CSC	This work was partially supported by CSC(No. 2019062400056). The author is grateful to Prof. Guofang Wang for his advice in this subject. The author would like to express his hearty thanks to the anonymous referee for his/her valuable comments and suggestions. J	Bisatt, M; Dokchitser, T				Bisatt, Matthew; Dokchitser, Tim			Tame torsion and the tame inverse Galois problem	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article								Fix a positive integer g and a squarefree integer m. We prove the existence of a genus g curve C/Q such that the mod m representation of its Jacobian is tame. The method is to analyse the period matrices of hyperelliptic Mumford curves, which could be of independent interest. As an application, we study the tame version of the inverse Galois problem for symplectic matrix groups over finite fields. J	Chase, Z; Hann-Caruthers, W; Tamuz, O				Chase, Zachary; Hann-Caruthers, Wade; Tamuz, Omer			Additive conjugacy and the Bohr compactification of orthogonal representations	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article; Early Access							PROPERTY-T	We say that two unitary or orthogonal representations of a finitely generated group G are additive conjugates if they are intertwined by an additive map, which need not be continuous. We associate to each representation of G a topological action that is a complete additive conjugacy invariant: the action of G by group automorphisms on the Bohr compactification of the underlying Hilbert space. Using this construction we show that the property of having almost invariant vectors is an additive conjugacy invariant. As an application we show that G is amenable if and only if there is a nonzero homomorphism from L-2(G) into R/Z that is invariant to the G-action. J	Li, QF				Li, Qifeng			Fano deformation rigidity of rational homogeneous spaces of submaximal Picard numbers	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							GEOMETRY; MANIFOLDS	We study the question whether rational homogeneous spaces are rigid under Fano deformation. In other words, given any smooth connected family pi : X -> Z of Fano manifolds, if one fiber is biholomorphic to a rational homogeneous space S, is pi an S-fibration? The cases of Picard number one were answered by Hwang and Mok. The manifold F(1, Q(5)) is the unique rational homogeneous space of Picard number one that is not rigid under Fano deformation, and a Fano degeneration of it is constructed by Pasquier and Perrin. For higher Picard number cases, one notices that the Picard number of a rational homogeneous space G/P satisfies rho(G/ P) = rank(G). Weber and Wi ' sniewski proved that the rational homogeneous spaces G/P with rho(G/ P) = rank(G) (i.e. complete flag manifolds) are rigid under Fano deformation. In this paper, we show that the rational homogeneous spaces G/P with rho(G/P) <= rank(G) - 1 are rigid under Fano deformation, provided that G is a simple algebraic group of type ADE, and G/ P is not biholomorphic to F(1, 2, P3) or F(1, 2, Q6). We also show that F(1, 2, P3) has a unique Fano degeneration, which is explicitly constructed. Furthermore, the structure of possible Fano degenerations of F(1, 2, Q6) is also described explicitly. Our main result is obtained by applying the theory of Cartan connections and symbol algebras.	[Li, Qifeng] Inst Basic Sci IBS, Ctr Complex Geometry, Daejeon 34126, South Korea	Institute for Basic Science - Korea (IBS)	Li, QF (corresponding author), Inst Basic Sci IBS, Ctr Complex Geometry, Daejeon 34126, South Korea.	qifengli@ibs.re.kr		Li, Qifeng/0000-0002-9232-1316	Institute for Basic Science [IBS-R032-D1]	Institute for Basic Science	This work was supported by the Institute for Basic Science (IBS-R032-D1). J	Domelevo, K; Kriegler, C; Petermichl, S				Domelevo, Komla; Kriegler, Christoph; Petermichl, Stefanie			H-infinity calculus for submarkovian semigroups on weighted L-2 spaces	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							FUNCTIONAL-CALCULUS; FRACTIONAL-POWERS; L-P; OPERATORS; THEOREMS; DOMAINS; KERNELS; BOUNDS	Let (T-t)(t >= 0) be a markovian (resp. submarkovian) semigroup on some sigma-finite measure space (Omega, mu). We prove that its negative generator A has a bounded H-infinity (Sigma(theta)) calculus on the weighted space L-2(Omega, wd mu) as long as the weight w : Omega -> (0, infinity) has finite characteristic defined by Q(2)(A) (w) = sup(t>0) parallel to T-t(w)T-t (w(-1))parallel to(L infinity(Omega)) (resp. by a variant for submarkovian semigroups). Some additional technical conditions on the semigroup have to be imposed and their validity in examples is discussed. Any angle theta > pi/2 is admissible in the above H-infinity calculus, and for some semigroups also certain theta = theta(w) < pi/2 depending on the size of Q(2)(A) (w). The norm of the H-infinity (Sigma(theta)) calculus is linear in the Q(2)(A) characteristic for theta > pi/2. We also discuss negative results on angles theta < pi/2. Namely we show that there is a markovian semigroup on a probability space and a Q(2)(A) weight w without Hormander functional calculus on L-2(Omega, wd mu).	[Domelevo, Komla; Petermichl, Stefanie] Univ Wurzburg, Inst Math, Emil Fischer Str 40, D-97074 Wurzburg, Germany; [Kriegler, Christoph] Univ Clermont Auvergne, CNRS, LMBP, F-63000 Clermont Ferrand, France	University of Wurzburg; Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique (CNRS); Universite Clermont Auvergne (UCA)	Kriegler, C (corresponding author), Univ Clermont Auvergne, CNRS, LMBP, F-63000 Clermont Ferrand, France.	komla.domelevo@mathematik.uni-wuerzburg.de; christoph.kriegler@uca.fr; stefanie.petermichl@mathematik.uni-wuerzburg.de			French National Research Agency ANR (project Front) [ANR-17-CE40-0021]; project HASCON [ANR-18-CE40-0021]; European Research Council [DLV-862402]; Alexander von Humboldt Stiftung	French National Research Agency ANR (project Front)(French National Research Agency (ANR)); project HASCON; European Research Council(European Research Council (ERC)European Commission); Alexander von Humboldt Stiftung(Alexander von Humboldt Foundation)	The second author acknowledges support by the grant ANR-17-CE40-0021 of the French National Research Agency ANR (project Front) and by the grant ANR-18-CE40-0021 (project HASCON). J	Kreck, M; Su, Y				Kreck, Matthias; Su, Yang			Finiteness and infiniteness results for Torelli groups of (hyper-)Kahler manifolds	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article; Early Access								The Torelli group T ( X) of a closed smoothmanifold X is the subgroup of themapping class group pi(0)(Diff(+) ( X)) consisting of elements which act trivially on the integral cohomology of X. In this note we give counterexamples to Theorem 3.4 by Verbitsky (DukeMath J 162(15):2929-2986, 2013) which states that the Torelli group of simply connected Kahler manifolds of complex dimension >= 3 is finite. This is done by constructing under some mild conditions homomorphisms J : T (X) -> H-3(X; Q) and showing that for certain Kahler manifolds this map is non-trivial. We also give a counterexample to Theorem 3.5 (iv) in (Verbitsky in Duke Math J 162(15):2929-2986, 2013) where Verbitsky claims that the Torelli group of hyperkahler manifolds are finite. These examples are detected by the action of diffeomorphsims on pi(4)( X). Finally we confirm the finiteness result for the special case of the hyperkahler manifold K-[2].	[Kreck, Matthias] Univ Bonn, Math Inst, Bonn, Germany; [Kreck, Matthias] Goethe Univ Frankfurt, Math Inst, Frankfurt, Germany; [Su, Yang] Chinese Acad Sci, Acad Math & Syst Sci, HLM, Beijing 100190, Peoples R China; [Su, Yang] Univ Chinese Acad Sci, Sch Math Sci, Beijing 100049, Peoples R China	University of Bonn; Goethe University Frankfurt; Chinese Academy of Sciences; Chinese Academy of Sciences; University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, CAS	Kreck, M (corresponding author), Univ Bonn, Math Inst, Bonn, Germany.; Kreck, M (corresponding author), Goethe Univ Frankfurt, Math Inst, Frankfurt, Germany.	kreck@math.uni-bonn.de; suyang@math.ac.cn			Projekt DEAL	Projekt DEAL	Open Access funding enabled and organized by Projekt DEAL. J	Lee, J; Heo, Y; Hong, S; Lee, JB; Park, BJ; Park, Y; Yang, CW				Lee, Jongho; Heo, Yaryong; Hong, Sunggeum; Lee, Jin Bong; Park, Bae Jun; Park, Yejune; Yang, Chan Woo			The Hormander multiplier theorem for n-linear operators	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article						Primary 42B15; Secondary 42B20; 42B25	MULTILINEAR FOURIER MULTIPLIERS; MINIMAL SOBOLEV REGULARITY	In this paper, we study the Hormander multiplier theorem for multilinear operators. We generalize the result of Tomita (J Funct Anal 259(8):2028-2044, 2010) to wider target spaces and extend that of Grafakos and Van Nguyen (Monatsh Math 190(4):735-753, 2019) to multilinear operators. We indeed give two different proofs: The first proof is based on the results of Grafakos et al. (Can J Math 65(2):299-330, 2013; II J Math Soc Jpn 69(2):529-562, 2017), Grafakos and Van Nguyen (Colloq Math 144(1):1-30, 2016; Monatsh Math 190(4):735-753, 2019), Miyachi and Tomita (Rev Mat Iberoam 29(2):495-530, 2013) and for the second one we provide a new and original approach, inspired by Muscalu et al. (Acta Math 193(2):269-296, 2004). We also give an application and discuss the sharpness of the result. J	Bucher, M; Burger, M; Iozzi, A				Bucher, Michelle; Burger, Marc; Iozzi, Alessandra			Integrality of volumes of representations	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article; Early Access								Let M be an oriented complete hyperbolic n-manifold of finite volume. Using the definition of volume of a representation previously given by the authors in [3] we show that the volume of a representation rho:pi(1)(M)-> Isom(+)(H-n), properly normalized, takes integer values if n is even and >= 4. If M is not compact and 3-dimensional, it is known that the volume is not locally constant. In this case we give explicit examples of representations with volume as arbitrary as the volume of hyperbolic manifolds obtained from M via Dehn fillings.	[Bucher, Michelle] Univ Geneva, Sect Math, 2-4 Rue Lievre,Case Postale 64, CH-1211 Geneva 4, Switzerland; [Burger, Marc; Iozzi, Alessandra] Swiss Fed Inst Technol, Dept Math, Ramistr 101, CH-8092 Zurich, Switzerland	University of Geneva; Swiss Federal Institutes of Technology Domain; ETH Zurich	Iozzi, A (corresponding author), Swiss Fed Inst Technol, Dept Math, Ramistr 101, CH-8092 Zurich, Switzerland. J	Huang, XJ; Wang, XP				Huang, Xiaojun; Wang, Xieping			Complex geodesics and complex Monge-Ampere equations with boundary singularity	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							HOLOMORPHIC MAPPINGS; DIRICHLET PROBLEM; REGULARITY; DOMAINS; THEOREM	We study complex geodesics and complex Monge-Ampere equations on bounded strongly linearly convex domains in C-n. More specifically, we prove the uniqueness of complex geodesics with prescribed boundary value and direction in such a domain, when its boundary is of minimal regularity. The existence of such complex geodesics was proved by the first author in the early 1990s, but the uniqueness was left open. Based on the existence and the uniqueness proved here, as well as other previously obtained results, we solve a homogeneous complex Monge-Ampere equation with prescribed boundary singularity, which was first considered by Bracci et al. on smoothly bounded strongly convex domains in C-n.	[Huang, Xiaojun] Rutgers State Univ, Dept Math, New Brunswick, NJ 08903 USA; [Wang, Xieping] Univ Sci & Technol China, Sch Math Sci, Hefei 230026, Anhui, Peoples R China	Rutgers State University New Brunswick; Chinese Academy of Sciences; University of Science & Technology of China, CAS	Wang, XP (corresponding author), Univ Sci & Technol China, Sch Math Sci, Hefei 230026, Anhui, Peoples R China.	huangx@math.rutgers.edu; xpwang008@ustc.edu.cn			NSF [DMS-1665412, DMS-2000050]; NSFC [11771412, 12001513]; NSF of Anhui Province [2008085QA18]; CPSF [2017M620072]	NSF(National Science Foundation (NSF)); NSFC(National Natural Science Foundation of China (NSFC)); NSF of Anhui Province(Natural Science Foundation of Anhui Province); CPSF(China Postdoctoral Science Foundation)	Xiaojun Huang was partially supported by NSF grants DMS-1665412 and DMS-2000050. J	Tao, JM; Zhao, YF				Tao, James; Zhao, Yifei			Central extensions by K-2 and factorization line bundles	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article; Early Access								Let X be a smooth, geometrically connected curve over a perfect field k. Given a connected, reductive group G, we prove that central extensions of G by the sheaf K-2 on the big Zariski site of X, studied in Brylinski-Deligne [5], are equivalent to factorization line bundles on the Beilinson-Drinfeld affine Grassmannian Gr(G). Our result affirms a conjecture of Gaitsgory-Lysenko [13] and classifies factorization line bundles on Gr(G).	[Tao, James] MIT, 77 Massachusetts Ave, Cambridge, MA 02139 USA; [Zhao, Yifei] Harvard Univ, Cambridge, MA 02138 USA; [Zhao, Yifei] Univ Paris Saclay, Orsay, France	Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT); Harvard University; UDICE-French Research Universities; Universite Paris Saclay	Zhao, YF (corresponding author), Harvard Univ, Cambridge, MA 02138 USA.; Zhao, YF (corresponding author), Univ Paris Saclay, Orsay, France.	jamestao@mit.edu; yifei@math.harvard.edu							0	0	0	1	1	SPRINGER HEIDELBERG	HEIDELBERG	TIERGARTENSTRASSE 17, D-69121 HEIDELBERG, GERMANY	0025-5831	1432-1807		MATH ANN	Math. J	Greenblatt, M				Greenblatt, Michael			Fourier transforms of indicator functions, lattice point discrepancy, and the stability of integrals	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article								We prove sharp estimates for Fourier transforms of indicator functions of bounded open sets in R-n with real analytic boundary, as well as nontrivial lattice point discrepancy results. Both are derived from estimates on Fourier transforms of hypersurface measures. Relations with maximal averages are discussed, connecting two conjectures of Iosevich and Sawyer (Adv Math 132(1):46-119, 1997). We also prove a theorem concerning the stability under function perturbations of the growth rate of a real analytic function near a zero. This result is sharp in an appropriate sense. It implies a corresponding stability result for the local integrablity of negative powers of a real analytic function near a zero.	[Greenblatt, Michael] Univ Illinois, Chicago, IL 60607 USA	University of Illinois System; University of Illinois Chicago; University of Illinois Chicago Hospital	Greenblatt, M (corresponding author), Univ Illinois, Chicago, IL 60607 USA.	greenbla@uic.edu						Arnold V. J	Krannich, M				Krannich, Manuel			On characteristic classes of exotic manifold bundles	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article								Given a closed simply connected manifold M of dimension 2n >= 6, we compare the ring of characteristic classes of smooth oriented bundles with fibre M to the analogous ring resulting from replacing M by the connected sum M Sigma with an exotic sphere Sigma. We show that, after inverting the order of Sigma in the group of homotopy spheres, the two rings in question are isomorphic in a range of degrees. Furthermore, we construct infinite families of examples witnessing that inverting the order of Sigma is necessary.	[Krannich, Manuel] Ctr Math Sci, Wilberforce Rd, Cambridge CB3 0WB, England	University of Cambridge	Krannich, M (corresponding author), Ctr Math Sci, Wilberforce Rd, Cambridge CB3 0WB, England.	krannich@dpmms.cam.ac.uk		Krannich, Manuel/0000-0003-1994-5330	Danish National Research Foundation through the Centre for Symmetry and Deformation [DNRF92]; European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union [682922]	Danish National Research Foundation through the Centre for Symmetry and Deformation; European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union(European Research Council (ERC))	I would like thank Oscar Randal-Williams for asking me a question which led to this work, as well as for many enlightening discussions and his hospitality at the University of Cambridge. J	Gutman, Y; Tsankov, T; Zucker, A				Gutman, Yonatan; Tsankov, Todor; Zucker, Andy			Universal minimal flows of homeomorphism groups of high-dimensional manifolds are not metrizable	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article								Answering a question of Uspenskij, we prove that if X is a closed manifold of dimension 2 or higher or the Hilbert cube, then the universal minimal flow of Homeo(X) is not metrizable. In dimension 3 or higher, we also show that the minimal Homeo(X)flow consisting of all maximal, connected chains in X has meager orbits. J	Balacheff, F; Karam, S; Parlier, H				Balacheff, Florent; Karam, Steve; Parlier, Hugo			The minimal length product over homology bases of manifolds	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							GIRTH	Minkowski's second theorem can be stated as an inequality for n-dimensional flat Finsler tori relating the volume and the minimal product of the lengths of closed geodesics which form a homology basis. In this paper we show how this fundamental result can be promoted to a principle holding for a larger class of Finsler manifolds. This includes manifolds for which first Betti number and dimension do no necessarily coincide, a prime example being the case of surfaces. This class of manifolds is described by a non-vanishing condition for the hyperdeterminant reduced modulo 2 of the multilinear map induced by the fundamental class of the manifold on its first Z(2)-cohomology group using the cup product. J	Luza, MF; Loray, F				Luza, Maycol Falla; Loray, Frank			Neighborhoods of rational curves without functions	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article								We prove the existence of (non compact) complex surfaces with a smooth rational curve embedded such that there does not exist any formal singular foliation along the curve. In particular, at arbitrary small neighborhood of the curve, any meromorphic function is constant. This implies that the Picard group is not countably generated.	[Luza, Maycol Falla] Univ Fed Fluminense, Rua Mario Santos Braga S-N, Niteroi, RJ, Brazil; [Loray, Frank] Univ Rennes, CNRS, IRMAR UMR 6625, F-35000 Rennes, France	Universidade Federal Fluminense; Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique (CNRS); CNRS - National Institute for Mathematical Sciences (INSMI); Universite de Rennes	Loray, F (corresponding author), Univ Rennes, CNRS, IRMAR UMR 6625, F-35000 Rennes, France.	maycolfl@gmail.com; frank.loray@univ-rennes1.fr			CNRS; Henri Lebesgue Center; CAPES-COFECUB Project [Ma 932/19];  [ANR-16-CE40-0008]	CNRS(Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique (CNRS)); Henri Lebesgue Center; CAPES-COFECUB Project(Coordenacao de Aperfeicoamento de Pessoal de Nivel Superior (CAPES)); 	Frank Loray is supported by CNRS, Henri Lebesgue Center and ANR-16-CE40-0008 project "Foliage". J	Mramor, A; Payne, A				Mramor, Alexander; Payne, Alec			Ancient and eternal solutions to mean curvature flow from minimal surfaces	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article								We construct embedded ancient solutions to mean curvature flow related to certain classes of unstable minimal hypersurfaces in Rn+1 for n >= 2. These provide examples of mean convex yet nonconvex ancient solutions that are not solitons, meaning that they do not evolve by rigid motions or homotheties. Moreover, we construct embedded eternal solutions to mean curvature flow in Rn+1 for n >= 2. These eternal solutions are not solitons, are O(n) x O(1)-invariant, and are mean convex yet nonconvex. They flow out of the catenoid and are the rotation of a profile curve which becomes infinitely far from the axis of rotation. As t -> infinity, the profile curves converge to a grim reaper for n >= 3and become flat for n=2. Concerning these eternal solutions, we also show they are asymptotically unique up to scale among the embedded O(n)xO(1)-invariant, eternal solutions with uniformly bounded curvature and a sign on mean curvature.	[Mramor, Alexander] Univ Calif Irvine, Dept Math, Irvine, CA 92617 USA; [Payne, Alec] NYU, Courant Inst, New York, NY 10012 USA	University of California System; University of California Irvine; New York University	Payne, A (corresponding author), NYU, Courant Inst, New York, NY 10012 USA.	mramora@uci.edu; ajp697@nyu.edu		Payne, Alec/0000-0003-4976-7774				ABRESCH U, 1986, J DIFFER GEOM, V23, P175; Altschuler S, 1995, J GEOM ANAL, V5, P293, DOI 10.1007/BF02921800; ALTSCHULER SJ, 1994, CALC VAR PARTIAL DIF, V2, P101, DOI 10.1007/BF01234317; ALTSCHULER SJ, 1991, J DIFFER GEOM, V34, P491; Angenent S.B., 2018, ARXIV180301399; Angenent S. J	Lei, Z; Ren, X; Zhang, QS				Lei, Zhen; Ren, Xiao; Zhang, Qi S.			A Liouville theorem for Axi-symmetric Navier-Stokes equations on R-2 x T-1	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article								We establish a Liouville theorem for bounded mild ancient solutions to the axi-symmetric incompressible Navier-Stokes equations on (-infinity, 0]x(R-2 x T-1), i.e. those solutions which are also periodic in z direction. The result, inspired by the works Chen et al. (Lower bound on the blow-up rate of the axisymmetric Navier-Stokes equations. International Mathematics Research Notices. IMRN, 8(artical ID rnn016, 31 pp), 2008), Chen et al. (II Commun Partial Differ Equ 34(1-3):203-232, 2009) and Koch et al. (Acta Math 203(1):83-105, 2009), can be regarded as a step forward to completely solve the conjecture on (-infinity, 0] x R-3 which was made in Koch et al. (Acta Math 203(1):83-105, 2009) to describe the potential singularity structures of the Cauchy problem. No unverified decay assumption is made on the solutions. J	Mukherjee, M; Saha, S				Mukherjee, Mayukh; Saha, Soumyajit			Nodal sets of Laplace eigenfunctions under small perturbations	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article							2ND EIGENFUNCTION; INNER RADIUS; RIEMANNIAN-MANIFOLDS; GENERIC PROPERTIES; EIGENVALUES; COMPACT; LINE; GEOMETRY; SPECTRUM	We study the stability properties of nodal sets of Laplace eigenfunctions on compact manifolds under specific small perturbations. We prove that nodal sets are fairly stable if such perturbations are relatively small, more formally, supported at a sub-wavelength scale. We do not need any generic assumption on the topology of the nodal sets or the simplicity of the Laplace spectrum. As an indirect application, we are able to show that a certain "Payne property" concerning the second nodal set remains stable under controlled perturbations of the domain.	[Mukherjee, Mayukh; Saha, Soumyajit] Indian Inst Technol, Powai 400076, Maharashtra, India	Indian Institute of Technology System (IIT System); Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) - Bombay	Mukherjee, M (corresponding author), Indian Inst Technol, Powai 400076, Maharashtra, India.	mathmukherjee@gmail.com; ssaha@math.iitb.ac.in			Council of Scientific and Industrial Research, India	Council of Scientific and Industrial Research, India(Council of Scientific & Industrial Research (CSIR) - India)	The authors are grateful to IIT Bombay for providing ideal working conditions. J	Frazier, M; Roudenko, S				Frazier, Michael; Roudenko, Svetlana			Littlewood-Paley theory for matrix-weighted function spaces	MATHEMATISCHE ANNALEN			English	Article								We define the vector-valued, matrix-weighted function spaces (F) over dot(p)(alpha q)(W) (homogeneous) and F-p(alpha q)(W) (inhomogeneous) on R-n, for alpha is an element of R, 0 < p < infinity, 0 < q <= infinity, with the matrix weight W belonging to the A(p) class. For 1 < p < infinity, we show that L-p(W) = (F) over dot(p)(alpha q)(W), and, for k is an element of N, that F-p(k2)(W) coincides with the matrix-weighted Sobolev space Lkp(W), thereby obtaining Littlewood-Paley characterizations of L-p(W) and L-k(p)(W). We show that a vector-valued function belongs to (F) over dot(p)(alpha q)(W) if and only if its wavelet or phi-transform coefficients belong to an associated sequence space (F) over dot(p)(alpha q)(W). We also characterize these spaces in terms of reducing operators associated to W.
